title: Subnetting Introduction
description: Configure subnet masks to create separate networks. Understanding CIDR notation.
requirements: Hosts A and B must be on the same network
Hosts C and D must be on a separate network with only 2 usable IPs
Use appropriate subnet masks for each network
hints: /30 gives you 4 IPs total (2 usable, 1 network, 1 broadcast)
A subnet mask of 255.255.255.128 (/25) divides the network in half
Check if 104.198.241.125 and 104.198.241.222 are in the same /25 subnet
For the /30 network with D at .253, C could be .252 or .254
